intro: Sisymbrium nanum, commonly known as dwarf mustard, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, followed by small, triangular pods that contain several seeds. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium nanum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
